command-line.description: Command line used to execute attack step, if any.

detections.description: Detections by the victim's monitoring capabilities.

dst-domain.description: Domain destination of the attack step, if any.

dst-ip.description: IP destination of the attack step, if any.

dst-misc.description: Other type of source of the attack step, if any. This can be e.g. localhost.

expected-response.description: Response or detection expected (in case of purple teaming)

key-step.description: Was this attack step object a key step within the context of the incident/event?

source-domain.description: Domain source of the attack step, if any.

source-ip.description: IP source of the attack step, if any.

source-misc.description: Other type of source of the attack step, if any. This can be e.g. rotating ip from cloud providers such as AWS, or localhost.

description: An object defining a singular attack-step. Especially useful for red/purple teaming, but can also be used for actual attacks.
name: attack-step
